language.name: Using JasonQuery for the first time
Thank you for your interest in JasonQuery.
JasonQuery is free for commercial and personal use.
The following three guarantees, you can use JasonQuery with peace of mind:
1. JasonQuery will not read from or write to the registry.
2. JasonQuery will not modify your database unless you manually execute DDL/DML SQL statements.
2-1. DDL/DML SQL statements, such as Create/Alter/Insert/Update/Delete...
2-2. You need to press the "Commit" button or manually execute the "Commit" command.
3. All settings or SQL history will be stored in the following file:
1. It is portable, multilingual, lightweight and easy to use
2. Support version checking and one-click update
4. Connect to Oracle directly through TCP/IP protocol without involving the Oracle Client
5. Advanced SQL editor with syntax highlighting
6. Support Paging Query(customized): 500 records per page
7. Support Auto Replace(customized): Keyword binding for favorite queries, such as "sf => select * from"
8. Automatically detect parameters, such as "WHERE id = :id AND name = :name"
9. Automatically direct to wrong location of SQL statement and display error message
10. Schema Browser, SQL History and many useful features...
11. Fixed bugs and added features from time to time
Now click "OK" to get started to work with you database.
Free for commercial and personal use.
To report bugs, mail to tachiroyu@gmail.com.
Free Icons - Icons8 (download free icons in PNG and SVG)
Free Chinese Fonts - JasonHandwriting (SIL Open Font License)
This is the parameter name in SQL statement.

A new version of JasonQuery is available:
You are using the latest version of JasonQuery.
Call Updater.exe to download and update lastest files.
Open the url with your default browser
Use JasonQuery to download the file directly
How to manually update JasonQuery to the latest version:
3. Unzip "JasonQuery x64" or "JasonQuery x86" to the folder where JasonQuery is currently located (overwrite all, JasonQuery.7z does not include JasonQuery.db)
Step1: Manually close all running JasonQuery
Step2: Download JasonQuery.zip to temporary folder
Step3: Unzip JasonQuery.zip to temporary folder
Step4: Update files and Delete temporary filles
All files have been successfully updated!
Please close all running JasonQuery manually!
Press OK to close the program.
Press OK to close the program and automatically launch JasonQuery.
Please try again or update manually by yourself!
Browse existing database file on local computer
Open the specified file below after connecting to database
Wrong password or not a database file!
It's an alias or nickname for easy identification.
If necessary, you can rename it next time you connect.
Are you sure you want to delete the record below?
All related records will be deleted.
You can get the SID using one of the following SQL statements.
If you get the error message below when you execute SQL statement:
You can enable Unicode function and try again.
By executing that wrong SQL statement, postgreSQL will not terminate the execution by itself.
So you need to rollback manually.
In the Direct mode, JasonQuery connects to an Oracle server directly, with third party libraries - Devart.Data.Oracle.
It allows JasonQuery to work with Oracle directly through TCP/IP protocol without involving the Oracle Client software.
You only need to have operating system with TCP/IP protocol support.
You can change the color theme from [Tools] > [Options] > [General].
A shortcut has been created on the desktop!
Password will be encrypted with your domain username.
If you do not want your password to be stored in "JasonQuery.db", please uncheck "Save Password".
Could not resolve your password correctly.

Connection pooling enables JasonQuery to use a connection from a pool of connections that do not need to be reestablished for each use. Once a connection has been created and placed in a pool, JasonQuery can reuse that connection without performing the complete connection process.
If it is enabled, when you disconnect the database connection, the actual connection is not closed in order to be used later by JasonQuery. This boosts performance greatly.
If it is disabled, the database connection will not be seen from the server when the connection is disconnected.
Number of column names per line:

This feature is enabled by default. When you press "Next Page", the previous query results will be automatically merged.

Global Setting (for all your database connection)
Don't automatically check for updates. I will check for updates manually.
Notify me when an update is available, but let me download it manually.
Active Tab is shown in bold
Changing the color theme from dark to normal requires restarting JasonQuery for the best display.
If your mouse or keyboard have no activity within 1~9 hour(s), JasonQuery will automatically close the database connection.
When you execute any SQL statement again, JasonQuery will automatically connect to the database.

If the'Pooling' function is enabled when the database is connected, the actual connection will not be closed after the connection is disconnected, so that JasonQuery can continue to use it later. This greatly improves performance.
If the'Pooling' function is disabled when the database is connected, the database connection will not be seen from the server when the connection is disconnected.
Open the "releasenotes.html" with your default browser
Open the "reportbugs.html" with your default browser
Free for commercial and personal use.

The settings have been copied. Please restart JasonQuery!
On the connection screen, check "Enable Unicode" to avoid this error.
"Raw Data Mode": It can speed up data display greatly.
When you enable "Raw Data Mode", the following settings will not be applied to the presentation of the data table:
The file you are trying to save already exists!
Do you want to replace it?
The function is not yet complete!
You cannot change this setting unless you restart JasonQuery.
Getting schema information (include all column information of Tables) ...
Show column information in the Query Editor's Schema Browser.
If it is enabled, it may take a long time to get all column information of Tables.
You can change the setting from [Tools] > [Options] > [Query Editor].
